title: fcp.anthropic - Anthropic AI Provider Connector
description:
# FCP Anthropic Connector - Anthropic AI Provider

## Overview
A comprehensive connector for Anthropic's Claude API, enabling agents to leverage Claude models for complex reasoning, tool use, vision capabilities, and batch processing with built-in cost tracking and budget enforcement.

## Priority: P1 (Critical Infrastructure)

## Core Capabilities

### 1. Messages API
- Send messages to Claude models
- Streaming responses for real-time output
- Multi-turn conversations
- System prompts
- Model selection (claude-opus-4-5-20251101, claude-sonnet-4-20250514, claude-haiku, etc.)
- Temperature and sampling controls
- Max tokens configuration
- Stop sequences

### 2. Tool Use Support
- Define tools with JSON schema
- Handle tool_use responses
- Execute tools and return results
- Multi-tool conversations
- Parallel tool execution
- Tool choice forcing (auto, any, specific)

### 3. Vision Capabilities
- Images in prompts (base64 or URL)
- Multiple images per message
- Image analysis and description
- Document/screenshot understanding
- Chart and diagram interpretation

### 4. Prompt Caching
- Cache system prompts
- Cache large context documents
- Cache tool definitions
- Automatic cache management
- Cache hit/miss tracking
- Cost savings calculation

### 5. Batch API
- Submit batch requests
- Track batch status
- Retrieve batch results
- Cancel batches
- Cost-efficient bulk processing
- 50% cost reduction for batch jobs

### 6. Cost Tracking & Budget Enforcement
- Per-request cost calculation
- Running total tracking
- Budget limits per agent/session
- Alerts at thresholds
- Automatic cutoff at budget limit
- Cost attribution and reporting

## FCP Integration

### Manifest Structure
```toml
[connector]
name = "fcp.anthropic"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Anthropic Claude API integration with cost tracking"

[capabilities]
messages = { risk = "medium", description = "Send messages to Claude" }
streaming = { risk = "medium", description = "Stream responses" }
tool_use = { risk = "medium", description = "Use tools in conversations" }
vision = { risk = "medium", description = "Process images" }
batch = { risk = "low", description = "Submit batch requests" }

[trust_zones]
default = "z:ai:inference"

[resources]
rate_limit_rpm = 1000
rate_limit_tpm = 100000
default_timeout_ms = 120000

[billing]
track_costs = true
budget_enforcement = true
```

### Tool Definitions
```yaml
tools:
  - name: anthropic_message
    description: Send a message to Claude
    parameters:
      model: 
        type: string
        enum: [claude-opus-4-5-20251101, claude-sonnet-4-20250514, claude-3-5-haiku-20241022]
        required: true
      messages:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            role: { type: string, enum: [user, assistant] }
            content: { type: string }
        required: true
      system: { type: string }
      max_tokens: { type: integer, default: 4096 }
      temperature: { type: number, default: 1.0, min: 0, max: 1 }
      stream: { type: boolean, default: false }

  - name: anthropic_message_with_tools
    description: Send a message with tool definitions
    parameters:
      model: { type: string, required: true }
      messages: { type: array, required: true }
      tools:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            name: { type: string }
            description: { type: string }
            input_schema: { type: object }
      tool_choice: 
        type: object
        properties:
          type: { type: string, enum: [auto, any, tool] }
          name: { type: string }

  - name: anthropic_message_with_vision
    description: Send a message with images
    parameters:
      model: { type: string, required: true }
      messages:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            role: { type: string }
            content:
              type: array
              items:
                oneOf:
                  - type: object
                    properties:
                      type: { const: text }
                      text: { type: string }
                  - type: object
                    properties:
                      type: { const: image }
                      source:
                        type: object
                        properties:
                          type: { enum: [base64, url] }
                          media_type: { type: string }
                          data: { type: string }

  - name: anthropic_batch_create
    description: Create a batch request
    parameters:
      requests:
        type: array
        items:
          type: object
          properties:
            custom_id: { type: string }
            params: { type: object }
        required: true

  - name: anthropic_batch_status
    description: Get batch status
    parameters:
      batch_id: { type: string, required: true }

  - name: anthropic_batch_results
    description: Get batch results
    parameters:
      batch_id: { type: string, required: true }

  - name: anthropic_get_usage
    description: Get current usage and costs
    parameters:
      period: { type: string, enum: [session, day, month] }
```

## Cost Tracking

### Pricing Model (as of implementation)
| Model | Input (per 1M tokens) | Output (per 1M tokens) |
|-------|----------------------|------------------------|
| claude-opus-4-5-20251101 | $15.00 | $75.00 |
| claude-sonnet-4-20250514 | $3.00 | $15.00 |
| claude-3-5-haiku | $0.25 | $1.25 |

### Budget Enforcement
```rust
struct BudgetConfig {
    max_per_request: Option<f64>,
    max_per_session: Option<f64>,
    max_per_day: Option<f64>,
    warning_threshold: f64,  // 0.0 - 1.0
}
```

### Cost Attribution
- Track costs per agent
- Track costs per task/session
- Track costs per tool
- Generate reports

## Prompt Caching Strategy
- System prompts > 1024 tokens: Always cache
- Tool definitions: Cache when > 5 tools
- Large documents: Cache with TTL
- Cache warming on connector init

## Error Handling
- Rate limit (429): Exponential backoff
- Overloaded (529): Queue and retry
- Invalid request (400): Parse and report
- Auth failure (401): Refresh credentials
- Context length exceeded: Truncation strategy

## Dependencies
- anthropic-rs or custom HTTP client
- reqwest (HTTP)
- tokio (async)
- serde (serialization)
- async-stream (streaming)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Send basic message and receive response
- [ ] Stream response tokens in real-time
- [ ] Use tools in conversation
- [ ] Process images in prompts
- [ ] Submit and retrieve batch jobs
- [ ] Track costs accurately per request
- [ ] Enforce budget limits
- [ ] Handle rate limits gracefully
- [ ] Utilize prompt caching
close_reason: Implemented Anthropic Claude API connector with Messages API, streaming support, cost tracking, and unit tests

title: fcp.grafana: Open-Source Observability Connector
description:
## Overview
Comprehensive observability connector for Grafana ecosystem, enabling AI agents to query metrics, analyze logs, inspect traces, and manage dashboards.

## Core Capabilities

### Metrics Querying (PromQL)
- Execute PromQL queries against Prometheus datasources
- Time range selection with relative and absolute times
- Aggregation and transformation functions
- Multi-datasource queries
- Query result formatting (tables, time series)

### Dashboard Access and Rendering
- List available dashboards by folder/tag
- Retrieve dashboard JSON definitions
- Render dashboard panels as images
- Variable interpolation for dynamic dashboards
- Export dashboards for backup/migration

### Alert Management
- List active and silenced alerts
- Query alert history and state transitions
- Create and modify alert rules
- Manage silence rules
- Acknowledge and annotate alerts

### Log Search (Loki Integration)
- LogQL query execution
- Log stream discovery
- Label-based filtering
- Pattern matching and parsing
- Log context retrieval around events

### Trace Inspection (Tempo Integration)
- Trace ID lookup and visualization
- Service map generation
- Span analysis and timing breakdown
- Cross-service correlation
- Trace-to-log linking

## Deployment Support

### Self-Hosted
- Direct API authentication
- Custom SSL/TLS configuration
- On-premise datasource access
- Air-gapped environment support

### Grafana Cloud
- Cloud API token authentication
- Stack management
- Usage metrics and billing info
- Multi-tenant organization support

## Implementation Notes
- Use Grafana HTTP API
- Support API key and OAuth authentication
- Handle rate limiting gracefully
- Cache frequently accessed dashboards

## Testing Requirements
- Mock Grafana server for unit tests
- Integration tests with test instance
- Performance tests for large queries
- Compatibility tests across Grafana versions

title: fcp.youtube - YouTube Data & Studio API Connector
description:
# fcp.youtube - YouTube Data & Studio API Connector

## Overview
Full YouTube integration covering video discovery, transcript extraction, analytics, and content management for media-rich Flywheel workflows.

## Archetype
**Hybrid: Request-Response + Polling**
- Request-Response: Data API for search, metadata, comments
- Polling: Analytics updates, processing status checks

## Key Operations

### Video Operations
- `youtube.video.get` - Get video metadata by ID
- `youtube.video.list` - List videos with filters
- `youtube.video.search` - Search videos with query
- `youtube.video.update` - Update video metadata (own videos)
- `youtube.video.delete` - Delete video
- `youtube.video.rate` - Like/dislike video
- `youtube.video.report_abuse` - Report video

### Transcript Operations
- `youtube.transcript.get` - Get video transcript
- `youtube.transcript.list` - List available transcript tracks
- `youtube.transcript.auto` - Get auto-generated captions
- `youtube.transcript.manual` - Get manually uploaded captions
- `youtube.transcript.translate` - Get translated transcript
- `youtube.caption.upload` - Upload caption track
- `youtube.caption.update` - Update caption track
- `youtube.caption.delete` - Delete caption track

### Channel Operations
- `youtube.channel.get` - Get channel by ID
- `youtube.channel.list` - List channels (by username, etc.)
- `youtube.channel.mine` - Get authenticated user's channel
- `youtube.channel.sections` - Get channel sections
- `youtube.channel.branding` - Get branding settings

### Playlist Operations
- `youtube.playlist.create` - Create playlist
- `youtube.playlist.update` - Update playlist metadata
- `youtube.playlist.delete` - Delete playlist
- `youtube.playlist.list` - List playlists
- `youtube.playlist.items.list` - Get playlist videos
- `youtube.playlist.items.add` - Add video to playlist
- `youtube.playlist.items.remove` - Remove from playlist
- `youtube.playlist.items.reorder` - Reorder playlist items

### Comment Operations
- `youtube.comment.list` - List video comments
- `youtube.comment.create` - Post comment
- `youtube.comment.reply` - Reply to comment
- `youtube.comment.update` - Edit comment
- `youtube.comment.delete` - Delete comment
- `youtube.comment.moderate` - Set moderation status
- `youtube.comment.threads` - Get comment threads

### Analytics Operations (YouTube Analytics API)
- `youtube.analytics.query` - Query analytics data
- `youtube.analytics.reports` - Generate reports
- `youtube.analytics.realtime` - Real-time view data
- `youtube.analytics.demographics` - Audience demographics
- `youtube.analytics.traffic` - Traffic sources
- `youtube.analytics.engagement` - Engagement metrics

### Upload Operations (Resumable Upload)
- `youtube.upload.init` - Initialize resumable upload
- `youtube.upload.chunk` - Upload video chunk
- `youtube.upload.status` - Check upload status
- `youtube.upload.resume` - Resume interrupted upload
- `youtube.upload.finalize` - Complete upload
- `youtube.upload.thumbnail` - Set video thumbnail

### Live Streaming Operations
- `youtube.live.broadcast.create` - Create broadcast
- `youtube.live.broadcast.bind` - Bind to stream
- `youtube.live.broadcast.transition` - Change broadcast state
- `youtube.live.stream.create` - Create live stream
- `youtube.live.chat.messages` - Get live chat messages
- `youtube.live.chat.send` - Send chat message

## Quota Management
YouTube API has complex quota system:
- Read operations: 1-100 units
- Write operations: 50-1600 units
- Daily quota: 10,000 units default

### Quota Strategy
- Query cost pre-calculation
- Quota budget allocation per workflow
- Caching layer to reduce redundant calls
- Batch requests where possible
- parts parameter optimization

## Zone Architecture
```
Zone 0 (Public):     Public video metadata, search results
Zone 1 (Authorized): User watch history, subscriptions
Zone 2 (Private):    Analytics data, unlisted videos
Zone 3 (Sensitive):  OAuth tokens, API keys
```

## Dependencies
- `fcp-core`: Base connector traits
- `fcp-oauth`: Google OAuth 2.0 flow
- `fcp-upload`: Resumable upload handling
- `fcp-cache`: Metadata caching

## Integration Points
- **Flywheel Media**: Video content indexing
- **Flywheel Knowledge**: Transcript ingestion for RAG
- **fcp.openai**: Transcript summarization
- **fcp.whisper**: Alternative transcription

## Implementation Notes
- Use YouTube Data API v3
- Implement exponential backoff for quota errors
- Cache video metadata (TTL: 1 hour)
- Support both API key and OAuth authentication
- Handle regional restrictions gracefully
- Implement proper ISO 8601 duration parsing
- Support snippet, contentDetails, statistics parts
- Handle live vs. uploaded vs. premiere video types

# fcp.github - GitHub API Connector

## Overview
Comprehensive GitHub integration supporting repositories, issues, PRs, actions, and webhooks for developer workflow automation.

## Archetype
**Hybrid: Request-Response + Webhook + GraphQL**

## Key Operations

### Repository Operations
- `github.repo.get/list/create/update/delete` - Repository management
- `github.repo.contents.get/create/update/delete` - File operations
- `github.repo.branches.list/get/create/delete` - Branch management
- `github.repo.tags.list` - Tag listing
- `github.repo.releases.list/get/create` - Release management
- `github.repo.collaborators.list/add/remove` - Access control

### Issue Operations
- `github.issue.create/get/update/close` - Issue CRUD
- `github.issue.list` - List with filters (state, labels, assignee)
- `github.issue.comments.list/create/update/delete` - Issue comments
- `github.issue.labels.add/remove` - Label management
- `github.issue.assignees.add/remove` - Assignee management

### Pull Request Operations
- `github.pr.create/get/update/close/merge` - PR lifecycle
- `github.pr.list` - List with filters
- `github.pr.reviews.list/create/submit` - Code review
- `github.pr.comments.list/create` - PR comments
- `github.pr.files.list` - Changed files
- `github.pr.commits.list` - PR commits
- `github.pr.checks.list` - Check runs

### Actions & Workflows
- `github.actions.workflows.list/get/dispatch` - Workflow management
- `github.actions.runs.list/get/cancel/rerun` - Workflow runs
- `github.actions.jobs.list/get/logs` - Job details
- `github.actions.artifacts.list/download` - Build artifacts

### Search Operations
- `github.search.repositories` - Repository search
- `github.search.code` - Code search
- `github.search.issues` - Issue/PR search
- `github.search.users` - User search

### User & Organization
- `github.user.get/authenticated` - User info
- `github.org.list/get` - Organization info
- `github.org.members.list` - Org members
- `github.org.teams.list/get` - Team management

### Webhook Operations
- `github.webhook.create/delete/list` - Webhook management
- `github.webhook.deliveries` - Delivery history
- Signature verification (X-Hub-Signature-256)

## API Support
- **REST API v3** - Primary for most operations
- **GraphQL API v4** - Complex queries, mutations
- **Webhooks** - Real-time event notification

## Rate Limiting
- 5,000 requests/hour (authenticated)
- 60 requests/hour (unauthenticated)
- GraphQL: 5,000 points/hour
- Secondary limits for search/creates

## Authentication
- OAuth 2.0 (web flow)
- Personal Access Token
- GitHub App (JWT + installation tokens)

## Zone Architecture
```
Zone 0 (Public):     Public repo metadata, public user info
Zone 1 (Authorized): Private repos (user scope)
Zone 2 (Private):    Organization data, team info
Zone 3 (Sensitive):  OAuth tokens, app credentials
```

## Dependencies
- fcp-core, fcp-oauth, fcp-graphql, fcp-ratelimit, fcp-webhook, fcp-testkit, fcp-telemetry

description:
# TEST: fcp-oauth Unit Test Suite

## Scope
Comprehensive unit tests for the OAuth2/OAuth1 authentication library.

## Test Categories

### OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code Flow
- [ ] Authorization URL generation with state/PKCE
- [ ] Token exchange with valid/invalid codes
- [ ] Refresh token flow
- [ ] Token expiration handling
- [ ] Scope validation

### OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Flow
- [ ] Token acquisition
- [ ] Caching and refresh

### OAuth 1.0a Flow (Twitter/legacy)
- [ ] Request token acquisition
- [ ] User authorization redirect
- [ ] Access token exchange
- [ ] Signature generation (HMAC-SHA1)

### Token Management
- [ ] Token storage/retrieval
- [ ] Token validation
- [ ] Secure token handling (no disk writes)

### Error Handling
- [ ] Invalid client credentials
- [ ] Expired tokens
- [ ] Revoked tokens
- [ ] Network failures

- `notion.database.create` - Create database

# Study: Clawdbot Discord Connector Implementation

## Objective

Research and document the existing clawdbot Discord connector implementation to extract patterns, learnings, and reusable components for building FCP connectors.

### 1. Architecture Overview

- [ ] Entry point and initialization

### 2. Discord API Integration

- [ ] REST API usage patterns
- [ ] Rate limiting implementation
- [ ] Retry logic and backoff
- [ ] Error handling strategies

### 3. Event Handling
- [ ] Event subscription model
- [ ] Event parsing and validation
- [ ] Event dispatching mechanism
- [ ] Event filtering capabilities
- [ ] Async event processing

### 4. Authentication & Security
- [ ] Token management
- [ ] Permission handling
- [ ] Credential storage patterns
- [ ] Security best practices used

### 5. Message Processing
- [ ] Message parsing
- [ ] Command extraction
- [ ] Response formatting
- [ ] Attachment handling
- [ ] Embed construction

### 6. State Management
- [ ] Guild/server state tracking
- [ ] User session management
- [ ] Cache strategies
- [ ] Persistence patterns

### 7. Testing Approach
- [ ] Unit test patterns
- [ ] Integration test setup
- [ ] Mock strategies for Discord API
- [ ] Test coverage areas

## Deliverables

1. **Architecture Diagram** - Visual representation of connector structure
2. **Pattern Catalog** - Documented patterns that can be reused
3. **Anti-Pattern Notes** - What to avoid based on learnings
4. **Reusable Components List** - Code/patterns that can be extracted
5. **Recommendations** - Suggestions for FCP connector design

## Questions to Answer

- How does clawdbot handle Discord's rate limits?
- What reconnection strategy is used for the gateway?
- How are slash commands registered and handled?
- How is state synchronized across restarts?
- What logging/observability patterns are used?

- Discord.js/Discord.py documentation (for comparison)
- Discord API documentation
- Existing connector documentation

- Research: 4-6 hours
- Documentation: 2-3 hours

title: fcp-webhook: Shared Webhook Handling Library
description:
# fcp-webhook: Shared Webhook Handling Library

## Overview
Production webhook handling library supporting signature verification, event routing, and delivery management for inbound webhooks.

## Signature Verification
- HMAC-SHA256 (Stripe, GitHub, Slack)
- HMAC-SHA1 (legacy)
- Ed25519 signatures
- Timestamp validation (replay prevention)
- Multiple algorithm support per provider

## Provider Support
- GitHub (X-Hub-Signature-256)
- Stripe (Stripe-Signature with timestamp)
- Slack (X-Slack-Signature)
- Linear (Linear-Signature)
- Discord (Ed25519)
- Custom providers via configuration

## Event Processing
- Event type routing
- Payload parsing (JSON, form-encoded)
- Event filtering and subscription
- Priority queue processing

## Delivery Management
- Idempotency (deduplication by event ID)
- At-least-once delivery guarantee
- Retry scheduling for failures
- Dead letter queue
- Delivery status tracking

## Security
- IP allowlist verification
- Request size limits
- Timeout enforcement
- TLS certificate validation

## Observability
- Delivery metrics
- Latency tracking
- Error categorization
- Audit logging

## Dependencies
- hmac, sha2, ed25519-dalek
- serde_json, chrono
- fcp-core, fcp-telemetry

description:
# fcp.twitter - X/Twitter API Connector

## Overview
Full-featured Twitter/X API connector supporting social listening, content publishing, and real-time engagement workflows.

## Archetype
**Hybrid: Request-Response + Streaming + Webhook**
- Request-Response: Tweet CRUD, user lookups, search
- Streaming: Filtered stream API for real-time monitoring
- Webhook: Account Activity API for mentions, DMs, follows

## Key Operations

### Read Operations
- `twitter.search.tweets` - Search tweets with advanced query syntax
- `twitter.search.users` - User discovery and lookup
- `twitter.timeline.user` - Get user timeline
- `twitter.timeline.home` - Get authenticated user home timeline
- `twitter.trends.location` - Get trending topics by WOEID
- `twitter.trends.available` - List available trend locations
- `twitter.user.get` - Get user profile by ID or username
- `twitter.user.followers` - Get user followers with pagination
- `twitter.user.following` - Get accounts user follows
- `twitter.tweet.get` - Get tweet by ID with expansions
- `twitter.tweet.quotes` - Get quote tweets
- `twitter.tweet.retweets` - Get retweeters
- `twitter.dm.list` - List DM conversations
- `twitter.dm.get` - Get DM conversation messages

### Write Operations
- `twitter.tweet.create` - Post new tweet
- `twitter.tweet.reply` - Reply to existing tweet
- `twitter.thread.create` - Create tweet thread (atomic)
- `twitter.tweet.delete` - Delete owned tweet
- `twitter.tweet.retweet` - Retweet
- `twitter.tweet.like` - Like tweet
- `twitter.dm.send` - Send direct message
- `twitter.user.follow` - Follow user
- `twitter.user.unfollow` - Unfollow user
- `twitter.list.create` - Create list
- `twitter.list.add_member` - Add user to list

### Stream Operations
- `twitter.stream.filtered` - Filtered stream with rules
- `twitter.stream.rules.add` - Add stream filter rules
- `twitter.stream.rules.delete` - Remove stream rules
- `twitter.stream.sample` - 1% sample stream

### Webhook Operations
- `twitter.webhook.register` - Register webhook URL
- `twitter.webhook.subscriptions` - Manage account subscriptions
- `twitter.webhook.crc` - Handle CRC challenge

## API Version Support
- **v2 API (Primary)**: Modern endpoints, better rate limits
- **v1.1 API (Fallback)**: Legacy endpoints for unsupported v2 features
- Automatic version negotiation based on operation

## Rate Limit Strategy
- Token rotation pool (multiple app credentials)
- Per-endpoint rate limit tracking
- Exponential backoff with jitter
- Rate limit headers parsing (x-rate-limit-*)
- Request queuing with priority levels
- Burst protection with sliding window

## Zone Architecture
```
Zone 0 (Public):     Search results, public tweets, trends
Zone 1 (Authorized): Authenticated timelines, user data
Zone 2 (Private):    DM content, account settings
Zone 3 (Sensitive):  OAuth tokens, app credentials
```

## Dependencies
- `fcp-core`: Base connector traits, zone management
- `fcp-oauth`: OAuth 1.0a and OAuth 2.0 PKCE flows
- `fcp-streaming`: SSE/streaming response handling
- `fcp-webhook`: Webhook endpoint management

## Integration Points
- **Flywheel Beads**: Auto-create beads from tracked mentions
- **Flywheel Agents**: Social monitoring agent workflows
- **Flywheel Analytics**: Sentiment analysis pipeline
- **fcp.openai**: Sentiment classification integration

## Implementation Notes
- Use Twitter API v2 client library as base
- Implement automatic media upload chunking
- Handle Twitter Cards metadata extraction
- Support poll creation and results
- Implement conversation threading reconstruction

fcp-ratelimit: Shared Rate Limiting Library
description:
# fcp-ratelimit: Shared Rate Limiting Library

## Overview
Production-grade rate limiting library supporting multiple algorithms, provider-specific header parsing, and intelligent backoff strategies.

## Algorithms

### Token Bucket
- Configurable bucket size and refill rate
- Burst handling
- Per-endpoint buckets

### Sliding Window
- Fixed window with sliding calculation
- Accurate request counting
- Memory-efficient implementation

### Leaky Bucket
- Smooth request pacing
- Queue management
- Overflow handling

## Provider Header Parsing
- X-RateLimit-Limit/Remaining/Reset (standard)
- Retry-After header
- X-Rate-Limit-* variations
- Provider-specific formats (GitHub, Twitter, Stripe, OpenAI)

## Backoff Strategies
- Exponential backoff with configurable base/max
- Decorrelated jitter
- Truncated exponential
- Custom strategy support

## Features
- Thread-safe implementations
- Async-first design
- Request queueing with priorities
- Quota tracking (daily/hourly/monthly)
- Multi-tenant support

## Integration
- Middleware for HTTP clients
- Decorator for FCP operations
- Metrics emission
- Logging integration

## Dependencies
- tokio (async), parking_lot (sync primitives)
- fcp-core, fcp-telemetry
close_reason: Implemented fcp-ratelimit crate with token bucket, sliding/fixed window, leaky bucket algorithms, provider header parsing, and backoff strategies. All 20 tests passing.
